title: Tankard, 1884
markings: Doulton Lambeth in hexafoil florette mark in ceramic underside, t, also with 497 in center of base and a stamped 1884, date and GG incuse
signed: two monogram inscribed marks FEB, one as a script cypher with 240 underneath, the other as script FEB in a row, both in underside
description: Three handled stoneware tankard with glazed and incised ornament in shades of blue and olive enframe three ovals.  Within each oval a blue flamingo is modeled in relief against a stippled ground, light buff, each flamingo stands in brown grass.

tombstone.epitaph:
Tankard, 1884.
1884. Stoneware. Gift of Mrs. Paul Brandwein. 1974-25-1.
